author: @EmeraldProductions
text: Hi, I have a problem with inputing yes or no questions for python. In this script, when I say yes it should go to what I told the computer to do when I say yes, but instead it goes to what I told the computer to do when I said No. (This is in the last section of the script).    import cozmo  from cozmo.util import degrees, distance_mm, speed_mmps  def cozmo_program(robot: cozmo.robot.Robot):     robot.set_all_backpack_lights(cozmo.lights.blue_light)     robot.say_text("Hi my name is cozmo, What is your name?").wait_for_completed()      myName = input()      robot.say_text("Well HI," + myName).wait_for_completed()           # Drive forwards for 150 millimeters at 50 millimeters-per-second.     robot.drive_straight(distance_mm(150), speed_mmps(50)).wait_for_completed()     robot.drive_straight(distance_mm(-150), speed_mmps(100)).wait_for_completed()     robot.turn_in_place(degrees(-360)).wait_for_completed()      robot.say_text("Well do you like my moves " + myName).wait_for_completed()     a = input()  #here     if a == 'No' or 'no':         robot.say_text("Sorry for asking...").wait_for_completed()         robot.turn_in_place(degrees(240)).wait_for_completed()     elif a == 'yes' or "Yes":         robot.say_text("Thank you very much" + myName).wait_for_completed()         robot.drive_straight(distance_mm(-150), speed_mmps(100)).wait_for_completed()            cozmo.run_program(cozmo_program)

author: @BUFFDOENUT950
text: import re  print("Our Magical Calculator") print("Type 'quit' to exit\n") previous = 0 run = True  def performMath():     global run     global previous     equation = ""     if previous == 0:         equation = input("Enter equation:")     else:         equation = input(str(previous))     #How do I set the equation to 0 so that it is set  as "Enter equation"?<<<<<<<<<----      if equation == 'quit':         print("Goodbye vro!")         run = False     else:         equation = re.sub('[a-zA-Z,.:()" "]', '', equation)          if previous==0:             previous = eval(equation)          else:             previous =eval(str(previous)+ equation)  while run:     performMath()

author: @pythonprogrammer6938
text: # Using If, Elif, Else   def rerun_gender (): # Defines rerun_gender Â  Â  gender () Â  Â  Â  Â # Runs the program called genderÂ   def gender (): Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â # Defines gender Â  Â  print ("Are you Male or Female?") # prints "Are you Male or Female?" Â  Â  choice = input ("") Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  # Lets you answer  # The thing below means if any of those become True, it will activate the thing its ment to. # True + True = True, True + False = True, False + False = False, ("This doesnt matter how many True/Falses there are, in an # Or statement, aslong as 1 is true, it activates.  Â  Â  if choice == 'm' or Â choice == 'M' or choice == 'male' or choice == 'Male' or choice == 'MALE': # If choice == (Then the thing in '') Â  Â  Â  Â  print ("You are male!") Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  # prints "You are male!"  Â  Â  elif choice == 'f' or choice == 'F' or choice == 'female' or choice == 'Female' or choice == 'FEMALE': # Or if choice == (Then the thing in '') Â  Â  Â  Â  print ("You are female!") Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â # prints "You are female!"  Â  Â  else: Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  # If your response didnt match/fit in to any of the above: Â  Â  Â  Â  print ("Invalid Reponse!, answer with M/F") # prints "Invalid Reponse!, answer with M/F" Â  Â  Â  Â  rerun_gender () Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  # Runs rerun_gender  gender () # Runs the program called gender
